message: @garethr Looks promising. I'm going to give it a whirl on a project or two.
I'd love to hear what people think
I've finished off the first version of django-timelog yesterday: http://morethanseven.net/2011/06/09/Logging-django-performance.html

It's a django middleware and management command that first logs time taken to process views, and then you can run a command to analyze that. Giving you average time per view (or path) and things like the minimum and maximum.
Yeah, definitely seems promising and I'll give it a shot. Thanks for this.
Looks great. Might be worth making it more clear in the documentation that it has to be the first item in MIDDLEWARE_CLASSES.
I recently knocked up a similar idea, for use only in development, to log the number of queries for each request: https://gist.github.com/956843
